request.description:
http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1037/POST

POST /protocols/bacnet/communication/network/mstp-ports/{id}

This resource allows you to view and to set the MS/TP network configuration parameters.

{
  "enabled": false,
  "networkNumber": 6,
  "baudRate": 38400,
  "macAddress": 0,
  "maxMaster": 127,
  "maxInfoFrame": 3
}

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1036/GET

GET /protocols/bacnet/communication/network/mstp-ports

This resource lists all BACnet MS/TP ports.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1041/GET

GET /protocols/bacnet/communication/network/ip-ports/{id}/bbmd-list/{bbmdId}

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1041/DELETE

DELETE /protocols/bacnet/communication/network/ip-ports/{id}/bbmd-list/{bbmdId}

This is the details of a specific BBMD.

No body is needed.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1040/GET

GET /protocols/bacnet/communication/network/ip-ports/{id}/bbmd-list

This resource lists all the BBMD-enabled controllers located on other subnetworks.

BACnet/IP devices send broadcast discovery messages such as “Who-Is” as a means to discover other BACnet devices on the network. However, when there are two or more BACnet/IP subnetworks, broadcast messages do not pass through network routers that separate these subnetworks.
BBMD allows broadcast message to pass through a router: on each subnet, a single device has BBMD enabled. Each BBMD device ensures BACnet/IP connectivity between subnets by forwarding broadcast messages found on its subnetwork to each other, and then onto the local subnetwork as a broadcast message.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1040/POST

POST /protocols/bacnet/communication/network/ip-ports/{id}/bbmd-list

This resource lists all the BBMD-enabled controllers located on other subnetworks.

BACnet/IP devices send broadcast discovery messages such as “Who-Is” as a means to discover other BACnet devices on the network. However, when there are two or more BACnet/IP subnetworks, broadcast messages do not pass through network routers that separate these subnetworks.
BBMD allows broadcast message to pass through a router: on each subnet, a single device has BBMD enabled. Each BBMD device ensures BACnet/IP connectivity between subnets by forwarding broadcast messages found on its subnetwork to each other, and then onto the local subnetwork as a broadcast message.

All properties are required.

If the request is successful, the server responds with an Http Code 201 Created.


{
  "ip": "1.1.1.1",
  "port": 47807,
  "mask": "255.255.252.0"
}

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1042/GET

GET /protocols/bacnet/communication/network/ip-ports/{id}/foreign-devices

Some BACnet/IP devices also support a feature called Foreign Device Registration (FDR). FDR allows a BACnet/IP device to send broadcast messages to a device with BBMD enabled. The BBMD-enabled device will then forward these broadcast messages to all other BBMDs and onto all other FDR devices. If a subnet has only FDR supported devices then it does not need a local BBMD. These devices can register directly with a BBMD on another subnetwork.
http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1038/GET#

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1075/GET

GET /protocols/bacnet/communication/network/router-entries

This resource list all the value include in the routing table.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1035/GET

This resource allows you to enable the routing of BACnet packets between BACnet MS/TP controllers connected to the ECLYPSE Controller’s RS-485 port and other IP-connected controllers (for example, BACnet/IP controllers connected to the ECLYPSE Controller’s Ethernet Switch ports or controllers connected through Wi-Fi). For example, routing must be enabled for EC-NetAX to discover the BACnet MS/TP controllers connected to the ECLYPSE Connected System Controller’s RS-485 port.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1035/POST

This resource allows you to enable the routing of BACnet packets between BACnet MS/TP controllers connected to the ECLYPSE Controller’s RS-485 port and other IP-connected controllers (for example, BACnet/IP controllers connected to the ECLYPSE Controller’s Ethernet Switch ports or controllers connected through Wi-Fi). For example, routing must be enabled for EC-NetAX to discover the BACnet MS/TP controllers connected to the ECLYPSE Connected System Controller’s RS-485 port.
http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1034/GET

GET /protocols/bacnet/local

Resource URL: https://{deviceIP}/api/rest/v1/protocols/bacnet/local

Documentation: http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1022/GET

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1023/GET

GET /protocols/bacnet/local/objects

These objects represent physical inputs, outputs, and values used by and coming from software processes.

This resource lists all of the current objects on the device.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1023/GET

GET /protocols/bacnet/local/objects

These objects represent physical inputs, outputs, and values used by and coming from software processes.

This resource lists all of the current objects on the device.

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1023/GET

GET /protocols/bacnet/local/objects

These objects represent physical inputs, outputs, and values used by and coming from software processes.

This resource lists all of the current objects on the device.

This resource shows all the elements concerning a specific BACnet property and particularly the **value** attribute.   ## Resource Information: * URL: **https://{deviceIP}/api/rest/v1/protocols/bacnet/local/objects/{objectType}/{objectInstance}/properties/{propertyName}** * Support Query Parameter? **YES** * Requires Authentication? **YES**   ## Parameters ### encode (optional) Used when you are operating a browser without access to the header parameter. This allows you to choose which encoding you want to use for the response: * json * xml * text * bin All these resources can be used according what the resource allows. * Located in : **Query** * Example values : **encode=json**   ### accept (optional) If this parameter is not in the request, the **Application/Json** will be chosen by default. There are multiple possible values (according the resource): * Application/Json * Application/Xml * Application/Octet-stream * Text/Plain The first two are the most often used. * Located in : **Header** * Example values : **accept:application/json**   ### objectType (required) This is the object type string value. * Located in : **Path** * Example values : **analog-value**   ### objectInstance (required) This is the instance of a specific BACnet object type. * Located in : **Path** * Example values : **1**   ### propertyName (required) This is the name of the property. * Located in : **Path** * Example values : **object-name**   ## Object(s) Representation Object Name: **BacnetProperty** | Property Name | Type | Description | Method | | --- | :---: | --- | :---: | | **Name** | String | This property is the name of the BACnet property. | GET | | **IsArray** | Boolean | This property indicates if the BACnet property is an array or not. | GET | | **Implementation** | String | | GET | | **AsnValue** | String | This property is the ASN value of a BACnet property encoded in Base64. | GET | | **Value**
required | String | This property is the readable value of a BACnet property.
According the BACnet property, it's possible the type of this property vary. (See the description of the resource for more details) | GET
POST |   ## Example Body Response ### Application/Json URL Example: https://0.0.0.0/api/rest/v1/protocols/bacnet/local/objects/analog-value/1/properties/object-name ```json { "value": "VUBH_2AS01BOWW509PC22_U_", "asnValue": "dRkAVlVCSF8yQVMwMUJPV1c1MDlQQzIyX1Vf", "isArray": false, "implementation": "", "name": "objectName" } ```   ### Application/Xml URL Example: https://0.0.0.0/api/rest/v1/protocols/bacnet/local/objects/analog-value/1/properties/object-name ```xml objectName false dRkAVlVCSF8yQVMwMUJPV1c1MDlQQzIyX1Vf VUBH_2AS01BOWW509PC22_U_ ```

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1023/GET

http://eclypseapi.distech-controls.com/restApi/bacnet/resources/1023/GET

GET /protocols/bacnet/local/objects

These objects represent physical inputs, outputs, and values used by and coming from software processes.

This resource lists all of the current objects on the device.

*** > POST /protocols/bacnet/local/objects/read-property-multiple {.is-warning} *** Read multiple points in one request. This reduces the amount of network traffic required to transmit data. This resource supports three Content-types: * Application/Xml * Application/JSON * Text/Plain In the Body request, you need to specify the encoding attributes (*asn or text*). If you want to view all instances of one specific type use **instance=\"-1\"**. If you want to view all properties of one specific object use **property=\"all\"**. Both attributes can be combined. All fields are required except the **arrayIndex**.   ## Resource Information: * URL: **https://{deviceIP}/api/rest/v1/protocols/bacnet/local/objects/read-property-multiple** * Support Query Parameter? **NO** * Requires Authentication? **YES**   ## Parameters ### accept (optional) If this parameter is not in the request, the **Application/Json** will be chosen by default. There are multiple possible values (according the resource): * Application/Json * Application/Xml * Application/Octet-stream * Text/Plain The first two are the most often used. * Located in : **Header**   * Example values : **accept:application/json**   ### content-type There are multiple possible values according the resource: * Application/Json * Application/Xml * Application/Octet-stream * Text/Plain * Multipart/Form-data If this parameter is not present during the request, and error **415 Unsupported Media Type** will be thrown. * Located in : **Header**   * Example values : **content-type:application/json**   ### content-length The Content-Length entity-header field indicates the size of the entity-body. * Located in : **Header**   * Example values : **content-length:526**     ## Object(s) Representation Object Name: **ReadPropertyMultiple** | propertyName|type|description|post| | --- | --- | --- | --- | | **encode** | String | This property is used to indicate which type is needed to recover the values, or the type you are writing the values from/in the device : * text * asn | POST | **PropertyReferences** | Array | This object is an array of PropertyReference object. | POST | Object Name: **PropertyReference** | propertyName|type|description|post| | --- | --- | --- | --- | | **Type** | | This property is the name of the object type. | POST | **Instance** | | This property is the object's instance. | POST | **Property** | | This property is the object's property name | POST | **ArrayIndex** | | This property is the index used to read a table property value. Use **-1** if there is no array index. | POST | **Message** | String | This property refers to the property value recovered. | POST | **Value** | | This property is used during a write property multiple to write the value. | POST |   ## Example Body Request ### Application/Json Url Example: https://1.1.1.1/api/rest/v1/protocols/bacnet/local/objects/read-property-multiple ```json { "encode": "asn", "propertyReferences": [ { "type": "analogValue", "instance": 1, "property": "objectName", "arrayIndex": -1 }, { "type": "analogValue", "instance": 2, "property": "objectName", "arrayIndex": -1 }, { "type": "analogValue", "instance": 95959, "property": "objectName", "arrayIndex": -1 }, { "type": "analogValue", "instance": 4, "property": "objectName", "arrayIndex": -1 } ] } ```   ### Text/Plain Url Example: https://1.1.1.1/api/rest/v1/protocols/bacnet/local/objects/read-property-multiple ``` asn analogValue¤1,2,3¤objectName,presentValue,priorityArray binaryValue¤-1¤objectName ```   ### Application/Xml Url Example: https://1.1.1.1/api/rest/v1/protocols/bacnet/local/objects/read-property-multiple ```xml ```   ## Example Body Response ### Application/Json Url Example: https://1.1.1.1/api/rest/v1/protocols/bacnet/local/objects/read-property-multiple ```json { "encode": "asn", "propertyReferences": [ { "type": "analogValue", "instance": 1, "property": "objectName", "arrayIndex": -1 }, { "type": "analogValue", "instance": 2, "property": "objectName", "arrayIndex": -1 }, { "type": "analogValue", "instance": 95959, "property": "objectName", "arrayIndex": -1 }, { "type": "analogValue", "instance": 4, "property": "objectName", "arrayIndex": -1 } ] } ```   ### Application/Xml Url Example: https://1.1.1.1/api/rest/v1/protocols/bacnet/local/objects/read-property-multiple ```xml ```   ### Text/Plain Url Example: https://1.1.1.1/api/rest/v1/protocols/bacnet/local/objects/read-property-multiple ``` asn analogValue¤1,2,3¤objectName,presentValue,priorityArray binaryValue¤-1¤objectName ```

Read multiple points in one request. This reduces
the amount of network traffic required to transmit data.

Use **-1** if there is no array index. | POST | **Message** | String | This property refers to the property value recovered. | POST | **Value** | | This property is used during a write property multiple to write the value. | POST |   ## Example Body Request ### Application/Json Url Example: https://1.1.1.1/api/rest/v1/protocols/bacnet/local/objects/read-property-multiple ```json { "encode": "asn", "propertyReferences": [ { "type": "analogValue", "instance": 1, "property": "objectName", "arrayIndex": -1 }, { "type": "analogValue", "instance": 2, "property": "objectName", "arrayIndex": -1 }, { "type": "analogValue", "instance": 95959, "property": "objectName", "arrayIndex": -1 }, { "type": "analogValue", "instance": 4, "property": "objectName", "arrayIndex": -1 } ] } ```   ### Text/Plain Url Example: https://1.1.1.1/api/rest/v1/protocols/bacnet/local/objects/read-property-multiple ``` asn analogValue¤1,2,3¤objectName,presentValue,priorityArray binaryValue¤-1¤objectName ```   ### Application/Xml Url Example: https://1.1.1.1/api/rest/v1/protocols/bacnet/local/objects/read-property-multiple ```xml ```   ## Example Body Response ### Application/Json Url Example: https://1.1.1.1/api/rest/v1/protocols/bacnet/local/objects/read-property-multiple ```json { "encode": "asn", "propertyReferences": [ { "type": "analogValue", "instance": 1, "property": "objectName", "arrayIndex": -1 }, { "type": "analogValue", "instance": 2, "property": "objectName", "arrayIndex": -1 }, { "type": "analogValue", "instance": 95959, "property": "objectName", "arrayIndex": -1 }, { "type": "analogValue", "instance": 4, "property": "objectName", "arrayIndex": -1 } ] } ```   ### Application/Xml Url Example: https://1.1.1.1/api/rest/v1/protocols/bacnet/local/objects/read-property-multiple ```xml ```   ### Text/Plain Url Example: https://1.1.1.1/api/rest/v1/protocols/bacnet/local/objects/read-property-multiple ``` asn analogValue¤1,2,3¤objectName,presentValue,priorityArray binaryValue¤-1¤objectName ```

This resource is the root of all BACnet objects and properties.
